inclusion.criterion: generally healthy, male or female, ages 18 to 80 years old
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: first degree relative with colorectal cancer under 60 at diagnosis
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: previously had removed early stage colon cancer (stage I or II) without adjuvant therapy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: previously had removed early stage colon cancer (stage III) >5 years ago
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: negative pregnancy test within 2 weeks of baseline flexible sigmoidoscopy for pre-menopausal women
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: pregnant or lactating women and women of child bearing potential unwilling to use acceptable birth control throughout the study
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: kidney disease, including kidney 'stones' or hypercalcemia
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Crohn's disease, or inflammatory bowel disease
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: any stomach or intestinal bleeding disorders (gastrointestinal bleeding from gastric or duodenal ulcers, or gastrin secreting tumors) or active gastric / duodenal ulcers - peptic ulcer disease (without bleeding in last 3 months)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: coagulopathy/hereditary hemorrhagic disorders/ or receiving therapeutic doses of Coumadin or heparin
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: hereditary and familial polyposis (HNPCC/ familial adenomatous polyposis (FAP); Lynch Syndrome)
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: calcium, Vitamin D, ginger, or fish oil supplements, including multivitamins that have low amounts of calcium/Vitamin D and fiber supplements within the last 14 days
exclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medications (NSAIDS), such as Aspirin or Ibuprofen, within the last 14 days
exclusion.label: met

notes: The patient is a healthy woman with no underlying disease. She has no history of allergies to any food or drugs and exercises regularly.
